definition: with an undeserved reputation (idiom); unwarranted fame/nowhere near as good as he's made out to be
disciple/apprentice/believer/on foot/bare or empty/to no avail/only/prison sentence
surname Tu
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: He is poor apology for a paladin.
sentences.chinese: 他只是个徒有虚名的游侠罢了。

sentences.english: He is a scholar of a kind.
sentences.chinese: 他是个徒有虚名的学者。

sentences.english: The system monitor chamber is only in name.
sentences.chinese: 体制监察室徒有虚名等。

sentences.english: Mr Green is a professor in name but not in reality.
sentences.chinese: 格林先生是徒有虚名的教授。

sentences.english: He is a ruler without power, a mere fly on the wheel .
sentences.chinese: 他是一个没有实权的统治者，只是徒有虚名而已。

sentences.english: This new atmosphere is not lifted shares in circulation as illusory.
sentences.chinese: 这种新气象，并非因为解禁股流通徒有虚名。

definition: with an undeserved reputation (idiom); unwarranted fame/nowhere near as good as he's made out to be
to have an undeserved reputation (idiom)
looks impressive but is worthless (idiom)/not as good as it looks/a reputation with no substance
the name does not correspond to reality (idiom); it doesn't live up to its reputation
the name does not reflect the reality (idiom); more in name than in fact/Reality does not live up to the name./Excellent theory, but the practice does not bear it out.
false reputation
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
a nobody/a nonentity
wine sack, food bag (idiom); useless person, only fit for guzzling and boozing
not more than so-so (idiom); mediocre/nothing out of the ordinary
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
to exaggerate/to overstate the facts
first under heaven/number one in the country
name/good reputation/title
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
strong in appearance but weak in reality (idiom)
